match.title: 1st ODI
match.statusText: South Africa won by 4 wickets (with 1 ball remaining)

series.name: NZ v SA
series.longName: South Africa tour of New Zealand

image.caption: A wide-angle view of the picturesque Seddon Park in Hamilton
image.longCaption: A wide-angle view of the picturesque Seddon Park in Hamilton, New Zealand v England, 1st Test, Hamilton, March 8, 2008

match.hoursInfo: 14.00 start, First Session 14.00-17.30, Interval 17.30-18.15, Second Session 18.15-21.45

headshotImage.caption: Tabraiz Shamsi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tabraiz Shamsi player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kane Williamson b Shamsi 59 (53b 4x4 2x6 73m) SR: 111.32

dismissalComment.html: and now he's gone. Just a hint of turn from Shamsi, and it's the perfect amount to induce uncertainty in Williamson's game. He originally shapes to cut, seeing the length short, but it pitches, moves off the pitch, does so seriously slowly as well, and ruins the batsman's timing. Inside edge onto the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Colin de Grandhomme player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Colin de Grandhomme player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Colin de Grandhomme not out 34 (19b 0x4 3x6 38m) SR: 178.94

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: full and straight from Morris. Latham falls over his flick and is hit on the pad. AB calls for a review, late, very late. Wasn't that more than 15 seconds? Nonetheless, the third umpire is called on to adjudicate. First impression is that it is a good review irrespective of the result. That's very close! All reds on HawkEye and Latham has to go. Pitched in line, check. Some swing subsequently, inswing. Takes the ball past Latham's inside edge, and hit him in front of middle and leg - the second red. Generally, if the first two are good, the third is good too, as is the case here. Good review from SA.

headshotImage.caption: Dean Brownlie player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dean Brownlie player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: SA's fielding has been really good today. Another good piece of fielding. Morris starts his new spell with a short delivery on middle. Brownlie pays the price for a bit of over-exuberance thinking he can clear the boundary even with bad timing. He hits it decently but picks out Behardien at deep square leg, who got across to his left and held a good catch

chipped back to Morris! It hasn't been the easiest surfaces to drive on the up. Full delivery on off, Taylor drives - the length was there to hit it - but he just hits the ball back to Morris, who holds on with both hands. Very good catch

headshotImage.caption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: the plan has worked! But that is not good batting from Broom. A short delivery on middle, it's well-directed. Broom is hustled for pace as he tries to pull over the fielder at square leg. He's hurried for pace and goes through with the stroke. All he succeeds at doing is finding the fielder who takes a simple catch

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: bouncer, hook, appeal for caught behind! The on-field decision from umpire Joel Wilson is not-out but South Africa go for a review. Over to you, Paul Reiffel. Inconclusive evidence on HotSpot but there's a massive spike on Snicko as the ball goes past the bat and Santner has to walk back. This short ball was too quick, it climbed too high, Santner was also looking to drag it from outside off. Basically a list of 'oh nos' fior a batsman

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: that's rather tame. No one even appeals because everyone knows its out. Neesham is cramped as he goes for a pull, and he's into his shot too early as well. Gets only a glove on it and the ball arcs over straight into de Kock's gloves. Rabada's like, 'Yeah, I do that all the time, man. No big'

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tom Latham lbw b Morris 0 (11b 0x4 0x6 16m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: full and straight from Morris. Latham falls over his flick and is hit on the pad. AB calls for a review, late, very late. Wasn't that more than 15 seconds? Nonetheless, the third umpire is called on to adjudicate. First impression is that it is a good review irrespective of the result. That's very close! All reds on HawkEye and Latham has to go. Pitched in line, check. Some swing subsequently, inswing. Takes the ball past Latham's inside edge, and hit him in front of middle and leg - the second red. Generally, if the first two are good, the third is good too, as is the case here. Good review from SA.

dismissalComment.html: bouncer, hook, appeal for caught behind! The on-field decision from umpire Joel Wilson is not-out but South Africa go for a review. Over to you, Paul Reiffel. Inconclusive evidence on HotSpot but there's a massive spike on Snicko as the ball goes past the bat and Santner has to walk back. This short ball was too quick, it climbed too high, Santner was also looking to drag it from outside off. Basically a list of 'oh nos' fior a batsman

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: James Neesham c de Kock b Rabada 29 (35b 2x4 0x6 66m) SR: 82.85

dismissalComment.html: that's rather tame. No one even appeals because everyone knows its out. Neesham is cramped as he goes for a pull, and he's into his shot too early as well. Gets only a glove on it and the ball arcs over straight into de Kock's gloves. Rabada's like, 'Yeah, I do that all the time, man. No big'

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock c Taylor b Boult 69 (64b 9x4 1x6 96m) SR: 107.81

dismissalComment.html: taken at short midwicket, Boult does it for his team yet again! This is the slower short ball and de Kock looks to muscle it the only close-in fielder on the leg side. The lack of pace does just enough to spoil his timing and Taylor moves quickly to his right, reaches out with both hands and comes up with a sharp catch

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers not out 37 (34b 3x4 0x6 72m) SR: 108.82

dismissalComment.html: utterly deceives him! Oh this is fantastic bowling. Full and angled into the leg stump from around the wicket with the sole purpose of making Duminy flick and close the face of the bat a little early. The slower ball does that job beautifully, takes the leading edge and ends up back in Southee's own hands

he's on a hat-trick! Hamilton roars in delight. This is top-class bowling on a pitch affording so much to them. The offcutter pitches on a good length just outside off, Behardien moves forward tentatively to defend, leaving a slight gap between bat and pad and half a second later his stumps are in disarray. That's a 120 kph R Ashwin offbreak

headshotImage.caption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: that's high, it's not long, it's another chance for New Zealand and Boult takes the catch running in at long-off. Lovely bowling from Santner. He sensed Morris was going to go and slows it down. The batsman looks to hit against the turn, looking for long-on, the leading edge is taken as the ball dips and turns just enough. Good catch completes a good play

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c & b Williamson 35 (43b 4x4 0x6 63m) SR: 81.39

dismissalComment.html: pops it back to the bowler, Williamson has gambled and he has won. He came into the attack looking for a bit of luck and he creates it by bowling wicket to wicket. Amla tries to manufacture a shot, coming down the track and flicking it, looking for wide mid-on. Mistimes it, to his great detriment and New Zealand's great joy

headshotImage.caption: Ish Sodhi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ish Sodhi player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis lbw b Sodhi 14 (18b 1x4 0x6 26m) SR: 77.77

dismissalComment.html: pins him in front. This is a beautifully tossed up legbreak, pitching on middle, dipping under the cross-bat shot as du Plessis sweeps. Is it turning too much? The batsman pins his hopes on that as he goes for a review. The impact is with the front pad first, that'll help Sodhi. No bat there, that'll also help Sodhi. Ball tracking says pitching in line, hitting in line and grazing off stump (umpire's call)

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock c Taylor b Boult 69 (64b 9x4 1x6 96m) SR: 107.81

dismissalComment.html: taken at short midwicket, Boult does it for his team yet again! This is the slower short ball and de Kock looks to muscle it the only close-in fielder on the leg side. The lack of pace does just enough to spoil his timing and Taylor moves quickly to his right, reaches out with both hands and comes up with a sharp catch

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy c & b Southee 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: utterly deceives him! Oh this is fantastic bowling. Full and angled into the leg stump from around the wicket with the sole purpose of making Duminy flick and close the face of the bat a little early. The slower ball does that job beautifully, takes the leading edge and ends up back in Southee's own hands

dismissalText.commentary: Farhaan Behardien b Southee 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: he's on a hat-trick! Hamilton roars in delight. This is top-class bowling on a pitch affording so much to them. The offcutter pitches on a good length just outside off, Behardien moves forward tentatively to defend, leaving a slight gap between bat and pad and half a second later his stumps are in disarray. That's a 120 kph R Ashwin offbreak

dismissalComment.html: that's high, it's not long, it's another chance for New Zealand and Boult takes the catch running in at long-off. Lovely bowling from Santner. He sensed Morris was going to go and slows it down. The batsman looks to hit against the turn, looking for long-on, the leading edge is taken as the ball dips and turns just enough. Good catch completes a good play

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentPreTextItems.html: Two from two. Mini conference between AB and Andile. Williamson and Southee's chat is longer.

commentTextItems.html: smacks it down the ground to win it for South Africa! Outstanding inning from de Villiers. Although to be honest, this might have been the easiest shot he's played on the night. Half-volley on off stump - Southee misses the yorker - and it's been biffed between the bowler and mid-off

commentPostTextItems.html: Quinton de Kock is the Man of the Match for his 69 off 64 balls on a slow, turning, tacky pitch.

"We never expected it to turn like that in the evening here in Hamilton. I thought we adapted exceptionally well. I certainly learned a lesson today on looking at wickets. It was a good win... We had to fight for every run here," AB de Villiers says

10.55 pm What a game! ODIs in New Zealand are becoming instant classics. At the start, Chris Morris picked up four wickets in no time. Then he gets carted around for 25 runs in the final over. New Zealand were struggling all through the middle overs, until an explosion at the end from Colin de Grandhomme and Tim Southee - 51 in 23 balls.

But Quinton de Kock played another innings that should mark him out as a player to watch out for in the future. An effortless half-century to put South Africa ahead, but Southee was front and centre in the second innings as well, picking up two wickets in two balls as New Zealand took four wickets in two overs to make a match of this.

Then AB de Villiers took over, playing serenly on a pitch that was turning square, so much that the offcutters Southee was bowling seemed like offbreaks from R Ashwin. Let's not forget 20-year old powerhouse Andile Phehlukwayo's contribution, nailing key boundaries in the last two overs to make it easier on his captain. So South Africa have won 12 games on the bounce, equalling their best streak in ODIs, and the second best ever. Thank you for joining us. Hope you enjoyed our coverage of a cracking game. Goodnight

Avneet : "My fellow Indians can stop giving references to Dhoni's ways now. AB, not even half at his mights has won it. He doesnt need to emulate anyone. The guy has collected 20+ runs off dale steyn twice amd 21 runs off Nehra to win for his team in last overs. Hopefully people give their doubts a rest. " It's very different in international cricket though and de Villiers, as great as he is, hasn't quite finished games off under pressure as often as he would like
Andy mac: "Good on ab . He may have lost the World Cup : but here's a good execution on getting a win. Partner did very well too after the mid order collapse"

commentPreTextItems.html: South Africa need three off three

commentTextItems.html: goes full and straight, Andile tries to flick, gets a leg bye behind square leg

commentPreTextItems.html: South Africa need only three from four now

commentTextItems.html: nails the yorker just outside off, Andile tries to dig it out but is beaten for pace
carries over the long-on boundary! This is a mis-hit. His balance is all over the place, leaning back from the shot, so he gets a toe end and yet it carries all the way. Short boundaries for the win

commentPreTextItems.html: Another mini-conference between Southee and Williamson. Will he bowl offcutters to the right-hander? Long-on back, mid-off up
raghav: "AB trying to do a Dhoni here : look to push it to the last ball and finish it off"

commentTextItems.html: slower bouncer, de Villiers tries to get on top of it and swat it into the leg side. Misses. They collect a bye too. Oh, and the height is too much. Called wide by the square leg ump

commentPreTextItems.html: South Africa need 12 off the final over. Southee to bowl. He's the team's vice-captain and he's got the captain Williamson in his ear as well. Andile on strike.
Dave Fern: "Can hardly watch, so close and so tense!"

commentTextItems.html: length ball outside off - it's the offcutter - beats the big slog. Could have been a dot, but Latham fumbles behind the wicket
smears a yorker well outside off through cover. He should be able to retain strike. Oh wait, he's going for a second run

headshotImage.caption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ish Sodhi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ish Sodhi player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: the wide yorker again at 136 kph and he beats de Villieres' slash to third man. Beats the inside edge
lands the yorker on middle, squeezes it out to cover for a quick single
slower ball, banished! Andile has the room to swing free. And he can get under it as well. Straight over long-off. Good area to hit. Massive hit in the context of the game

what a beauty. This is a full delivery, aiming for the base of off stump, tailing in as well. Andile clears his front leg looking for a boundary over long-on, but the ball sneaks under his swing and then cuts away to the wicketkeeper

commentPreTextItems.html: Boult for the penultimate over. South Africa need 22 off 12

commentTextItems.html: good bowling. He's keeping it away from AB's swing and the wide yorker works perfecly. The batsman is shaping to move to leg to free the arms but he has to reach out and jam it through the covers
pushes it through just outside off - the emphasis on not giving up boundaries - for the final ball of the over and Andile can only cut it to point. Good finish, Sodhi

headshotImage.caption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ish Sodhi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ish Sodhi player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: sweeps a flighted delivery from outside off past short fine leg, but deep square is there
another googly, this one shorter and outside off, Andile goes for a whip through midwicket and mis-hits it for a single
that's a big hit in the context of the game! Andile goes for the reverse sweep, taking a length ball from leg stump and belts it over short third man. Must have picked the googly

goes for a reverse sweep, de Villiers goes for a reverse sweep, but doesn't make any connection. Sodhi goes up for an lbw decision, umpire Wilson says not out, but New Zealand go for a review. Impact might be outside off. No bat there. Williamson would have hoped the ball hit de Villiers on the full so that the ball will then have to be tracked as going on with the arm. No luck

commentPreTextItems.html: South Africa need 29 off three overs. Sodhi to continue. Game on the line

commentTextItems.html: massive turn as Sodhi loops the ball up, asking for the drive. De Villiers goes for it, but with the ball dipping and turning sharply, he is easily beaten
this is a low full toss, tailing into the batsman, Andile goes for a heave over midwicket, and misses

headshotImage.caption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ish Sodhi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ish Sodhi player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: back of a length and angled into middle stump, de Villiers backs away and punches to deep point

headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: James Neesham c de Kock b Rabada 29 (35b 2x4 0x6 66m) SR: 82.85

dismissalComment.html: that's rather tame. No one even appeals because everyone knows its out. Neesham is cramped as he goes for a pull, and he's into his shot too early as well. Gets only a glove on it and the ball arcs over straight into de Kock's gloves. Rabada's like, 'Yeah, I do that all the time, man. No big'

headshotImage.caption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mitchell Santner c de Kock b Rabada 17 (27b 2x4 0x6 27m) SR: 62.96

dismissalComment.html: bouncer, hook, appeal for caught behind! The on-field decision from umpire Joel Wilson is not-out but South Africa go for a review. Over to you, Paul Reiffel. Inconclusive evidence on HotSpot but there's a massive spike on Snicko as the ball goes past the bat and Santner has to walk back. This short ball was too quick, it climbed too high, Santner was also looking to drag it from outside off. Basically a list of 'oh nos' fior a batsman

headshotImage.caption: Colin de Grandhomme player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Colin de Grandhomme player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Colin de Grandhomme not out 34 (19b 0x4 3x6 38m) SR: 178.94
Tim Southee not out 24 (13b 3x4 1x6 19m) SR: 184.61

headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: bouncer, hook, appeal for caught behind! The on-field decision from umpire Joel Wilson is not-out but South Africa go for a review. Over to you, Paul Reiffel. Inconclusive evidence on HotSpot but there's a massive spike on Snicko as the ball goes past the bat and Santner has to walk back. This short ball was too quick, it climbed too high, Santner was also looking to drag it from outside off. Basically a list of 'oh nos' fior a batsman

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: that's rather tame. No one even appeals because everyone knows its out. Neesham is cramped as he goes for a pull, and he's into his shot too early as well. Gets only a glove on it and the ball arcs over straight into de Kock's gloves. Rabada's like, 'Yeah, I do that all the time, man. No big'

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: full and straight from Morris. Latham falls over his flick and is hit on the pad. AB calls for a review, late, very late. Wasn't that more than 15 seconds? Nonetheless, the third umpire is called on to adjudicate. First impression is that it is a good review irrespective of the result. That's very close! All reds on HawkEye and Latham has to go. Pitched in line, check. Some swing subsequently, inswing. Takes the ball past Latham's inside edge, and hit him in front of middle and leg - the second red. Generally, if the first two are good, the third is good too, as is the case here. Good review from SA.

headshotImage.caption: Dean Brownlie player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dean Brownlie player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: SA's fielding has been really good today. Another good piece of fielding. Morris starts his new spell with a short delivery on middle. Brownlie pays the price for a bit of over-exuberance thinking he can clear the boundary even with bad timing. He hits it decently but picks out Behardien at deep square leg, who got across to his left and held a good catch

chipped back to Morris! It hasn't been the easiest surfaces to drive on the up. Full delivery on off, Taylor drives - the length was there to hit it - but he just hits the ball back to Morris, who holds on with both hands. Very good catch

headshotImage.caption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: the plan has worked! But that is not good batting from Broom. A short delivery on middle, it's well-directed. Broom is hustled for pace as he tries to pull over the fielder at square leg. He's hurried for pace and goes through with the stroke. All he succeeds at doing is finding the fielder who takes a simple catch

headshotImage.caption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tabraiz Shamsi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tabraiz Shamsi player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and now he's gone. Just a hint of turn from Shamsi, and it's the perfect amount to induce uncertainty in Williamson's game. He originally shapes to cut, seeing the length short, but it pitches, moves off the pitch, does so seriously slowly as well, and ruins the batsman's timing. Inside edge onto the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: James Neesham c de Kock b Rabada 29 (35b 2x4 0x6 66m) SR: 82.85

dismissalComment.html: that's rather tame. No one even appeals because everyone knows its out. Neesham is cramped as he goes for a pull, and he's into his shot too early as well. Gets only a glove on it and the ball arcs over straight into de Kock's gloves. Rabada's like, 'Yeah, I do that all the time, man. No big'

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock c Taylor b Boult 69 (64b 9x4 1x6 96m) SR: 107.81

dismissalComment.html: taken at short midwicket, Boult does it for his team yet again! This is the slower short ball and de Kock looks to muscle it the only close-in fielder on the leg side. The lack of pace does just enough to spoil his timing and Taylor moves quickly to his right, reaches out with both hands and comes up with a sharp catch

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c & b Williamson 35 (43b 4x4 0x6 63m) SR: 81.39

dismissalComment.html: pops it back to the bowler, Williamson has gambled and he has won. He came into the attack looking for a bit of luck and he creates it by bowling wicket to wicket. Amla tries to manufacture a shot, coming down the track and flicking it, looking for wide mid-on. Mistimes it, to his great detriment and New Zealand's great joy

headshotImage.caption: Ish Sodhi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ish Sodhi player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis lbw b Sodhi 14 (18b 1x4 0x6 26m) SR: 77.77

dismissalComment.html: pins him in front. This is a beautifully tossed up legbreak, pitching on middle, dipping under the cross-bat shot as du Plessis sweeps. Is it turning too much? The batsman pins his hopes on that as he goes for a review. The impact is with the front pad first, that'll help Sodhi. No bat there, that'll also help Sodhi. Ball tracking says pitching in line, hitting in line and grazing off stump (umpire's call)

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers not out 37 (34b 3x4 0x6 72m) SR: 108.82
Jean-Paul Duminy c & b Southee 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: utterly deceives him! Oh this is fantastic bowling. Full and angled into the leg stump from around the wicket with the sole purpose of making Duminy flick and close the face of the bat a little early. The slower ball does that job beautifully, takes the leading edge and ends up back in Southee's own hands

dismissalText.commentary: Farhaan Behardien b Southee 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: he's on a hat-trick! Hamilton roars in delight. This is top-class bowling on a pitch affording so much to them. The offcutter pitches on a good length just outside off, Behardien moves forward tentatively to defend, leaving a slight gap between bat and pad and half a second later his stumps are in disarray. That's a 120 kph R Ashwin offbreak

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Morris c Boult b Santner 16 (16b 3x4 0x6 22m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: that's high, it's not long, it's another chance for New Zealand and Boult takes the catch running in at long-off. Lovely bowling from Santner. He sensed Morris was going to go and slows it down. The batsman looks to hit against the turn, looking for long-on, the leading edge is taken as the ball dips and turns just enough. Good catch completes a good play

milestones.description: Hashim Amla has scored 24 hundreds in ODIs, the most for SA breaking de Villiers's record
Ross Taylor has scored 16 hundreds in ODIs, the most for NZ breaking Nathan Astle's record

stories.title: 'Experience-wise it was 10 out of 10' - de Villiers
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v South Africa, 1st ODI, Hamilton
stories.seoTitle: 'Experience-wise it was 10 out of 10' - AB de Villiers
stories.summary: While AB de Villiers graded the conditions at Seddon Park as a "0 out of 10" as far as Champions Trophy preparation goes, he gave the match itself full marks for demanding a fight from South Africa ahead of the major tournament

image.caption: AB de Villiers looks to set off for a run
image.longCaption: AB de Villiers looks to set off for a run, New Zealand v South Africa, 1st ODI, Hamilton, February 19, 2017

stories.title: The bowling effort that fizzled out
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v South Africa, 1st ODI, Hamilton
stories.seoTitle: The bowling effort that fizzled out
stories.summary: A rather rapid change of fortunes for Chris Morris, and New Zealand's slightly unusual choice of opening bowler make the plays of the day from Hamilton

image.caption: Tim Southee struck off consecutive balls in the 23rd over
image.longCaption: Tim Southee struck off consecutive balls in the 23rd over, New Zealand v South Africa, 1st ODI, Hamilton, February 19, 2017

stories.title: De Villiers, Phehlukwayo steer SA through jittery chase
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v South Africa, 1st ODI, Hamilton
stories.seoTitle: AB de Villiers, Phehlukwayo steer SA through jittery chase
stories.summary: The four-wicket victory was South Africa's 12th in a row, helping them equal their best run in the format
stories.byline: The Report by Andrew McGlashan in Hamilton

image.caption: Andile Phehlukwayo sweeps the ball
image.longCaption: Andile Phehlukwayo sweeps the ball, New Zealand v South Africa, 1st ODI, Hamilton, February 19, 2017

stories.title: Confident South Africa fix eyes on Champions Trophy
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v South Africa, 1st ODI, Hamilton
stories.seoTitle: Confident South Africa fix eyes on Champions Trophy
stories.summary: AB de Villiers, South Africa's one-day captain, believes there has never been as much belief in the squad as they currently have in the midst of an 11-match ODI winning streak

image.caption: AB de Villiers walks back
image.longCaption: AB de Villiers walks back, South Africa v West Indies, World T20 2016, Group 1, Nagpur, March 25, 2016

stories.title: Milne, McClenaghan look for ways to prove fitness
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v South Africa, 1st ODI, Hamilton
stories.seoTitle: Adam Milne and Mitchell McClenaghan look for ways to prove fitness
stories.summary: Head coach Mike Hesson is keen to consider Adam Milne and Mitchell McClenaghan for the Champions Trophy but has admitted playing time will be hard to come by for the pair

image.caption: Adam Milne is congratulated by Mitchell McClenaghan
image.longCaption: Adam Milne is congratulated by Mitchell McClenaghan,  New Zealand v Pakistan, 2nd T20I, Hamilton, January 17, 2016

stories.title: South Africa hunt record-equalling win in battle of two form sides
